definition: to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: Today the famous singer Zapp is coming to open a new ride. There are so many pepole.
sentences.chinese: 今天著名歌手扎普要來爲一個新的遊樂設施揭幕。

sentences.english: The 26th Asian Championship will tip off in China's Wuhan on September 15th.
sentences.chinese: 第26屆亞錦賽將於9月15日在中國武漢揭幕。

sentences.english: Fishastic ceremony inside design and execution.
sentences.chinese: 夢境的揭幕式，設計和實行都特殊好。

sentences.english: Fould likeastic ceremony in the design and execution.
sentences.chinese: 夢境的揭幕式，設計和實行都特別好。

sentences.english: SCO anti-terror drill kicks off in Kazakhstan .
sentences.chinese: 上海合作組織反恐演習在哈薩克斯坦揭幕。

sentences.english: Welcome to the opening ceremony of the photo exhibition "Expo 2010 Shanghai, China".
sentences.chinese: 接待列位出席“上海世博會圖片展”揭幕式勾當。

sentences.english: Fould likeastic ceremony at design and execution.
sentences.chinese: 夢境的揭幕式，設計和實行都十分好。

sentences.english: 《The Burghers of Calais》 was unveiled officially in London without a ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 《加萊義民》於倫敦正式揭幕，但卻沒有舉辦開幕式。

sentences.english: The World Cup opening game ends in a tie/draw .
sentences.chinese: 世界盃揭幕戰以平局收場。

sentences.english: Fantastic ceremony both in design and execution.
sentences.chinese: 夢幻的揭幕式，設計和執行都非常好。

sentences.english: My sculpture was unveiled. I left Bangkok.
sentences.chinese: 我在雕塑揭幕後離開了曼谷。

sentences.english: Memorial plaques were unveiled at each of the subway stations affected by the explosions.
sentences.chinese: 紀念牌揭幕在每個受到爆炸的地鐵車站。

sentences.english: Olympics Begin In Style; Swimmer Takes 1st Gold.
sentences.chinese: 奧運會盛大揭幕泳將奪首枚金牌。

sentences.english: South Africa and Mexico played to a 1-1 draw in the opening game。
sentences.chinese: 東道主南非隊在揭幕戰與墨西哥隊戰成1比1平。

sentences.english: The hosts Angola have been playing Mali in the opening game.
sentences.chinese: 在揭幕戰中，東道主安哥拉隊對戰馬裏隊。

definition: to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
to start shooting or firing/to win an initial success/to succeed (of a plan)
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
